title: A life could have been lost in Department of Correctional Services Boksburg!
text:
An employee of the Department of Correctional Services recently were involved in a car accident and as a consequence had to be treated in Hospital for his injuries.
Not having any identification that he was indeed working for the Department of Correctional Services, and would have a medical aid, he was then transferred to a General Hospital to receive treatment.
Had it not been for the fact that a member of the public had identified him hours later in the Cine that he was actually working for the Department and has a Medical Aid to pay for services rendered the chances are that he would or could have died from his injuries.
On being established that he has a medical aid the member then transferred to a Hospital at which he could receive the treatment that could not be provided at the General Hospital.
The importance of having identification paraphernalia is yet once again underlined of being of the utmost importance.
Yet the Department of Correctional Services seems to not really care about the consequences of members not having identification, and its ripple effect in society at large.
What must happen for the Department to realize that it can no longer delay the issuing of identification paraphernalia and should stop dragging its feet, and instill loyalty amongst its employees by recognizing at the end of the day that being able to identify themselves to the general public in all spheres would add to job efficiency, effectiveness and contribute to the value and dignity of the Department by recognizing their employees and showing that the employer really cares for its employees in this miniscule but major contributing manner.
